intro: Thesium fastigiatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a dense, spike-like inflorescence. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes other members known for their unique floral structures. Thesium fastigiatum is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
